storyInfo: Fulfilling a twenty-year-old promise, Iris sets out to find a particular individual. Along the way, she comes across a tiny, little Oripathy patient.

attributes.content: You're leaving today?
The Godmother only just gave you that staff, and all the things in the castle are still unsorted. Is it really so urgent?
It'll soon be time. No matter what, I cannot deliver things late.
Don't forget. We abide by agreements, and we never break promises.
I wasn't saying that. I just think it's all too sudden.
You could've chosen something much simpler first. Like choosing a well-behaved child to welcome at the castle, or giving the boys and girls sweet dreams. That sort.
It'd all be better than trying to find a girl from over ten years ago. We only know the name, and you lack any experience, Iris...
I do indeed lack experience.
But out of everyone who preceded me, none ever gave up a promise for its difficulty.
Sigh... Fine. If you insist, I can't stop you.
Then this metal thing. Yes. Keep it well.
Is thisâ€”a radio?
An obsolete kind. I fancy it'll barely receive the closest waves nowadays.
Keep jabbing at it like that, and you might jab it apart.
Here, for you. It'll be useful on the way, and I've kept the details packed with.
Oh, thank you.
I'm not that careless!
I've kept it nice! Letting someone else have it does not reassure me! You'd better not break it on the way!
You're worrying too much. That'd never happen!
Easy enough to say.
What...!
Now, now, enough fuss. No-one doubts your capability. We're all very aware.
It's only normal that everyone should worry for you on your first outing.
Hm-hmph.

You must stay safe outside, and safer still in front of strangers. Your transport is all ready. Remember to keep its parts maintained along your journey. Before you enter the wilderness, you must take full caution...
Ah, I've gone on too long. Regardless of anything, prioritize protecting yourself.
I know... I understand. Don't worry. It may be quite trying, but it'll be fine.
I must see this agreement through to the end. It's already been far too long since we set foot outdoors.
The children believe in us, and that's why they give us their cherished belongings for our safekeeping. We must return them as arranged. We cannot let their trust be in vain.
And so, even if they've grown up, and they no longer believe, I'll prove it to them still.
I'll proveâ€”
that fairytales are everlasting.
I see. Then may all go well for you.
We look forward to your return. Iris.
(Oh, I'm finally here.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (By the records, back then, the child should've been around here when she was taken in.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Tonnerre Village. The child's name was... Mabel. Good, all in order.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (But is... is this a village?)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hey, careful, little miss.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Don't go any further in, you'll mess up your shoes. Shoes like those, it'd be a shame if you did! We'd never afford to pay!
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Thank you for the warning.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: No problem.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: You seem like a little miss from a good old family. No escort with you? What're you up to in this kind of place?
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: I don't need an escort. I'm just looking for someone.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Moreover, this is Victoria. What's the problem with Victorian people being on their own soil?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Ha! Well put! Well put, little miss. Of course it's safest for our own people in our own home!
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: But still, best you watch out. You're young yet. See, there's been disturbance in the city recently. Careful where you step.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: The city...?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Er, never mind. What goes on in the city is nothing to do with me.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I've given you an answer. I think it's fair you give me one now.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: What's your question?
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: I came here to find someone, but...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Shouldn't there be a village here? Why don't I see anyone else?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: A village?
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: See for yourself, little miss. What looks like a village here to you?
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: There used to be a few villages around here, mind, but they've all left now. Old noble boy snapped this place up. There'll be construction starting this spring. Building a factory!
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: ...A factory...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Look here, this metal sheet, and this giant thing! Majestic, isn't it? Goes vrrmm!
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: It'sâ€”it's very cool.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: But, the factory... Why here? Why not on a nomadic plate?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: The old noble boy builds wherever he pleases. It's ours to ask why.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Could you tell me where all those villages here migrated to?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: What? Who the hell knows...
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Can't have moved far, I'll tell you that. This area's solid, after all, close to the city orbits. You only see refugees with nowhere to go head for the wastes!
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I understand. Thank you very much.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (...Still within expectations.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (It's already been close to twenty years. It wouldn't be odd for the child's village to relocate between then and now...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (I'll only be able to search a little bit of the surrounding area. At least the village's name, and the name of the child are still recorded. If worse comes to worst, I'll enter the city and see what I can do to find them.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Hmph. A hurdle this trifling could never stop me!)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Excuse me, is this Tonnerre Village?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: It's not? Alright, thank you, sorry to bother you.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hello, could I ask if anyone knows a girl named Mabel... erm, sorry, she should be a lady of about twenty. Does anyone know her?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I see, then...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Thank you, I'll go somewhere else and see if I can ask.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Sorry for the bother, but is this Tonnerre Village...?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Excuse me...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Iris recalled the words she grew up withâ€”To protect a paradise, a fragile dream, is never an easy thing.
It was only to fulfill a promise, to allow slumberland to last forever in the children's fledgling hearts. They always gave it their utmost, their all.
Dazzling dreamlands far-flung from reality became the gentle croons of nursery rhymes, broken into phrases kept in stories handed down across the land, down across hundreds and thousands of years.
She didn't want to give up.
She couldn't give up.
In fairytales, nothing was ever unachievable.
Within reality, achievement could only ask one's dedication to the task.
(Southwards from this road, and then turn east... pass through the forests here...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (There's a roadsign here. Mm. I should be going the right way.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (How many villages is this now? This is already the nomadic city's periphery plate. Look any further in, and I'll be entering the city...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Or perhaps, I should head outwards...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Never mind. I'd better find somewhere to keep the vehicle safe first.)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hm? What's that sound?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Daddy, are we going home?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Is my disease all better now? It still hurts... aren't we going to the doctor?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: We're going home... we're not going to the hospital, we're going home.
attributes.name: Man

attributes.content: Daddy bought you medicine. We'll go home and take it, and then it won't hurt, Dora.
attributes.name: Man

attributes.content: Huh? Do I have to take really bitter medicine again...? I don't wanna take it! No!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Dora, listen carefully, if you take your medicine your illness will be better.  So even if it's bitter, you have to be brave, okay?
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: But it's so bitter...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Last time, that burnt up paper was really hard to swallow. And then before that, the injecshun really hurt... mummy, can I stop seeing the doctor? I don't wanna get injecshuns, and I don't wanna take more medicine.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Can I go outside and play? I miss my friends at school. Maemae came to ask when I can play with her the day before. I wanna go out and play with her...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: (Sob)
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: Mummy, are you crying...?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Don't cry, mummy! I... I'll take my medicine, and I won't go outside at all! I'll stop complaining!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I'll listen to mummy and daddy. I'll be a good girl. So stop crying, mummy...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Dora, Dora... you're a good girl... why did it have to be you, why did it have to be you!?
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: My poor girl... oh...
attributes.name: Man

attributes.content: (An ill child...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: This mission's about over now. Give it the stamp for me.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: By the way, I brought some fruit from the south for Maemae. Are these the ones she threw a fit about wanting last time?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: You even brought something? You really are too kind.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Thank you for these, they're just the ones. Don't spoil her too much, now. Her teeth will fall out if she keeps eating sweet things all day!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: The only thing on her mind all day is play. Oh, this morning she insisted to me a fairy took her to stay at a castle last night. I think I've been telling her too many bedtime stories. She's still so silly, even at her age.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: She's still little.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: She's not little, she's almost about to go to school. Let's see... no issues with the mission. Do I just stamp on here for you?
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: That'll do.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Certainly. Have this back.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: You came back fairly fast this time. What's the city like now?
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Much better than I was expecting. Some talking politics in coffee shops, but just talking. Gatherings are peaceful.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Aside from the culture nuts, normal folk like us don't care about the political stuff, after all.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: There were some workers making a commotion on the street the day before because their payslips were too low, but nobody got hurt, thankfully.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Sounds like it wasn't much of an incident.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Who's that girl? She's not a local, is she?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Who? Oh, you mean her... you've got sharp eyes. Out of the blue, she came to this village just about yesterday.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: It sounds like she's looking for someone. First she asked the village's name, and that seemed right, and then she started going from house to house, asking.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: All she has is a name. Can't be easy finding them.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: I don't know how far she's been already, but that craft she came in's been dinged and scraped up to Hell and back. It's parked up by Mr. Eason's right now, waiting for repairs.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: The girl doesn't give up, I'll tell you that.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: We all want to help her too. Maemae's been helping her since the crack of dawn, running all over to knock and ask, and plenty of the kids with, all raring to go.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: She's coming over.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Excuse me.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Can I ask if Maemae's back yet?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Not yet. Don't know where she's run off to.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: How's it been going for you? Still haven't found who you're looking for?
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Not yet, no.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: What kind of person are you looking for?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What kind of person are you?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: You look out of place. And all goggled and masked, how suspicious!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hahahahaha!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Hey.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Ha, haha... she's not wrong, you know. First time I saw you, I was thinking the same thing!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Do I really look that shifty?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: The last thing I tell is lies!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Here, Miss, don't wrinkle your brow like that. Tell him about who you're looking for. Ignore him dressing like he's dangerous. He's actually a quite reliable guy.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Really? Er...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Don't your eyes hurt, glaring at each other so hard?
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: It's fine. I'm used to it.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Never mind. I'm not arguing with you.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: And I'm not arguing with a child.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Scowl)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Keep some things to yourself!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Seeing as you already know I'm looking for someone, why not tell you, I suppose.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Mabel. I'm looking for Mabel Grimm.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I don't like repeating myself.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Oh, don't you start glaring at each other again.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: I'm not that puerile!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I... in all honesty, I've never met her. But I know she's called Mabel, she's a Feline, and she has brown hair and green eyes.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: She should be roughly under thirty, and she's very nimble with her hands... That's all I've heard.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: But... I've gone around every single house in the village, and I still haven't found a clue whatsoever.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Is this really Tonnerre Village? I'd hate it if all along I'd gotten the name wrong...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: As sad it is to say, Miss, there's all too many villages whose names sound like ours. And your records aren't all that specific, not to mention, you're looking for someone from all those years ago.
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Oh, don't, now. Don't feel down. I'm sure you'll find her!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: I remember there were a few more houses in the forest beside the village. Have you been over there, yet?
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Worst comes to worst... to worst, mind you, give this fella a shout. Get him to take this mission on, and help you out!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: Oi. Wait a moment. Rhodes Island's missions all need to be registered, first...
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Whisper) Stop it with the office talk. The mission you had is done, isn't it! Look, are you going to help her, or not?!
attributes.name: Ordinary Clerk

attributes.content: (Whisper) ...Fine.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What are you plotting, all mysterious over there...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: What are you doing, following me?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Helping you.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I don't need it!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Shrug)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: You'll leave the village out this way. Going to visit the houses out on the edge?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Mm. I can do it on my own. This is my job. I don't need you to help!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Child labor?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What did you say?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: *cough*. Nothing.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Actually, I wanted to say, about the person you're looking for. I probably know them...
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: â€”Shh!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Wait, stop for a moment!)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Did you hear... a voice just now?)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: No! I won't have it!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Are you afraid?! You're afraid, aren't you?! You're scared of being sentenced, so you'd give our daughter over?!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I won't let you do anything of the sort!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: You can't give them Dora, they'll take her away, throw her into isolation! She's got a whole life ahead of her, and if she goes in there, she'll never come out again!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: This is my child, this is our bloody child! How could you?!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Just calm downâ€”keep it down a little!
attributes.name: Man's Voice

attributes.content: Why in the hell would I give Dora to them? I never said that! It's justâ€”it's just, how can you bear to see her like this?
attributes.name: Man's Voice

attributes.content: We can't cure her... we've tried every drug, we've taken her for every treatment they told us... Useless, all of it's been useless!
attributes.name: Man's Voice

attributes.content: There's already people suspicious of us because we're going and buying medicine! We can't keep hiding this! We need to figure out something soon!
attributes.name: Man's Voice

attributes.content: We'llâ€”We'll leave this place. We'll take Dora, and we won't stay here anymore. We can go somewhere where nobody livesâ€”
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: And where do we have to go?
attributes.name: Man's Voice

attributes.content: (The voices are coming from this side. Hrm... here. This house.)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (They were talking about...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Their daughter catching Oripathy, most likely.)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Hiding Infected. In Victoria, that's a fairly grave offence.)
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: (Dora... I've heard the name before...)
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I'm going to take a look!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: â€”Hold on, oi!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: She acts on the first word she hears... honestly, what a child.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What's the time, Mr. Wolf? ...3 o'clock!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: What's the time, Mr. Wolf? ...Dinnertime!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: This is no fun.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Dolly, dolly, I wish you could move. Then you could play with me.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Dolly, when do you think mummy and daddy will finally let me go outside?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I don't want to be ill. I hate being ill.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: My arm hurts... my belly hurts too...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Don't scratch. If you scratch, it might get even worse.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Covers mouth)
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: (Whisper) Who... who are you!?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: (Whisper) How did you come in? The windows are all closed... um, wait, you should get out quick! If my mummy and daddy find you, they'll get mad at us!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Windows like that can't stop me. It's okay, nobody will find us.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Were you playing something just now?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Do you want this doll to move, and play with you?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Of course! But... how does a dolly move?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: There's ways. Aren't there all sorts of little creatures in storybooks who can speak? If there are puppets who can be people, and cats who can walk on two legs, then of course there are dollies who can move.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hm... do you like listening to stories?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I do! Mummy's told me lots of stories before!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Like the child in the chimney, and the one with big scissors, and the garden with a fairy...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: And the one about a castle with tea parties!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: It's really, really big, and really, really pretty, and only good children can go to it, and inside, there's these really nice fairies, and they give you really nice cakes and stuff, and they have a tea party all day...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: And you can grab the clouds out of the sky, and they taste really sweet, too...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I really want to go to the castle, and be in the tea party, so, I've been trying really hard all the time to be a good girl. When will the fairies pick me up to go to the castle?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Perhaps, very soon, you'll have the chance.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: You're a good girl. I'm sure you will!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Really? That's super!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: When I go to the castle, will my dolly start moving, and play with me?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Mm-hm. You've heard it in stories, haven't you? At the fairies' castle, if you're a good child, they'll keep your most beloved treasures safe, and when the time comes, those treasures will come back to your side once again.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Dollies who live in the castle aren't ordinary dollies. They can move, and sing, and play games with you!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Do you want your dolly to come 'alive?'
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I... I really do...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: But, do I have to leave my dolly behind?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: If I have to, then I don't want to...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Wh... why?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: It won't take too much time. My friends... I mean, the fairies are really powerful, and I'm sure they'll let your dolly move in no time!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Just make sure everything's agreed, and your dolly will be back by your side before you know it!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: My mummy and daddy gave me this dolly for my birthday. I don't want to leave her.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: When I got my dolly, I told mummy that I'd protect her forever! I have to protect my own little girl, right?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Why do people all leave their treasure and stuff so the fairies can keep 'em?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: But you'reâ€”
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: ...But you're...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: You're fallen ill...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: If one day someone else finds you, they could take you away. If they really do, then you'll have no way to protect your dolly, right...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Um... daddy said the same thing, too.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: But, it's okay. I'll stay at home like they told me. Mummy and daddy won't let me get taken away!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: My dolly is my little girl, and I'll protect my dolly. Mummy and daddy said I'm their little girl, and mummy and daddy will protect me.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: So as long as I listen to them and be a good girl, I won't get taken away!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I can accept that...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hehee. Thank you for worrying about me.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Oh, um, I still haven't asked your name yet. Are you sure mummy and daddy won't find us? You're not... from our village, right? I've never seen you before.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I'm Dora. What about you?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I'm... Iris.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Iris!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Can you... can you play with me for a bit? Just a tiny bit!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: It's too boring by myself, and I can't play outside, so I can only draw stuff at home, and play jigsaws... and I've played them forever and I'm bored...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: You can't go outside?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: If I say I wanna go outside, then mummy will cry. 'Cause I've got a really bad disease, and if I go outside when I want, then bad people will take me away.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: They'll take me away, and then I'll never see mummy and daddy again.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I don't wanna make mummy cry, and I don't want to leave mummy and daddy behind. But...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: But I miss Maemae and all my friends, and I wanna go back to school.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Oh, don't feel down... I'llâ€”I'll play with you!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Do you like this one? Or this toy here, see, if you press it, it lights up! Let's play jigsaws for now, and then next time I'll bring you a new ragdollâ€”
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I'm sorry, this is as much as I can do... I don't have any way to let you go outside.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Iris, why are you being all weird and apolojettic? You didn't do anything wrong.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Um, do you think, if I really see a Miss Fairy, I can make a wish to her?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Of course you can! Fairies are enormously powerful!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: That's great! Will the Miss Fairies in the castle cure my disease?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: The Miss Fairies can't do everything, either...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I see, then...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Bâ€”But!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Even if they don't have a way to cure your disease! If you have any other desires as well, I'm sure they canâ€”
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Then, I want mummy to never cry again. Can they do that?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: That'sâ€”That's not possible, but if you have anything else!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Um... I want to grow up a little faster, too.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: That can't be done, either.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: It can't...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: None of it can be done...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Then never mind.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Dora, aren't you disappointed?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Don't you feel like... the fairies are so useless, that the fairytales are all liars?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: I'm gonna tell you a secret. You can't tell anyone else! Actually, my best friend Maemae came to play with me this morning, but she couldn't come in, so we talked through the window all secret.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Maemae said, last night, a Miss Fairy invited her to the castle, and Maemae wouldn't lie to me! She said it was like a dream in there, and the cakes and biscuits were all super tasty!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Maemae's a good girl too...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Mm-hm! But, if I meet a Miss Fairy, I won't mention any of the wishes from just now. Iris, you have to keep it a secret, too!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: A secret? Why?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Um, because, think about it! If the Miss Fairy knew she couldn't make my wishes come true, then she'd feel really bad. So I can't tell her about them.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: You've finally come out. Are you done talking with that girl in there?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: How did you know?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Had a chat with her mother and father, and I heard movement from the rooms inside.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What's wrong? Didn't go well?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: It's none of your business...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: How are her parents? Are they truly thinking about handing their daughter over?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I can reassure you, they don't want their daughter to leave their side. They just... can't think of another way.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: And on the off-chance someone else finds them, what'll happen?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Hrm... I'm guessing they'd immediately take the poorly girl away, and throw her in an isolation ward. The parents are harboring hidden Infected, so in all likelihood, they'd be sentenced too.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: But you don't need to worry about that too much right now. I've already introduced them to somewhere reliable.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What kind of place could even be reliable for people stuck in their situation?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I know what Dora has is Oripathy, and I know it's an awful disease with no current cure...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: What kind of place is it, huh... hrmm, it's a little hard to describe.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: But it's essentially somewhere where their daughter can receive treatment. Not somewhere where people just get split apart and left to die, or directly hung, or condemned to work in factories.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: ...It sounds like it has something going for it.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Obviously. But it's just a possibility I gave to them. It's up to them how they decide.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Victorian people have a strange sense of pride and superiority about their country and its soil. I've had the pleasure of knowing that more times than I can count.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What in the world makes you... are you being sarcastic?!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Ah... I don't mean it that way.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: It's just thatâ€”throwing away your current life in pursuit of a single possibility, that's something much easier said than done. Even if they opted to go on as things are in the end, I wouldn't be surprised any.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: That girl fallen ill still believes in fairytales. She's still that young.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I can't help her... she's a good child, but Iâ€”don't have anything I can do for her. One story, one dreamland. None of it, nearly enough to rescue her from her ailment...
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: But they let people have hope.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I might not know what's gnawing at you right now, but I think stories and sweet dreams are good things.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Wonderful things let people yearn, and let them have hope. In awful circumstances like these, letting people hold onto their longing for wonderful things like that, I think, is essential.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: After all, we need to first know what's good, and that's how we can have a direction to strive in, am I right?
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Then tell me about you. Do you believe in fairytales?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: I believe in some things even more idealistic than fairytales. If those count as fairytales too, then yes, I believe.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Don't let it weigh on you. There's so little we can do for others in the first place.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Right, you said you were looking for someone before...
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: If you have no other trails, then I actually know a girl called Mabel.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: I know she was originally Victorian, she's twenty-odd, brown-haired, green-eyed, and very nimble with her hands, though she's not a lover of manual work. She just likes fiddling with machine parts.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: For the moment... she matches up completely with your account.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: â€”! She matches so thoroughly; this can't just be a coincidence!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Where is she?! Tell me where she is!
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Mm-hm. I've actually gotten more sure the more I think about it.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: But, if she's really the one you're looking for, then you're actually a little late now.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: Certain things happening that probably aren't be up to me to tell.
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Or... maybe you should try going to meet her.
attributes.name: Field Operator
